discussion.content: A is correct

questions.question_text: A task worker asks how they can monitor any updates occurring to records assigned to him, like responses from customers. What do you suggest?

choices.B: Click on the eyeglass icon to expand the Monitor frame
choices.C: Open an Agent workspace tab for each record he wants to monitor
choices.D: Select Service Desk > My Work Dashboard

questions.question_text: When importing data from a spreadsheet, which step defines where the incoming data columns will be written in the receiving table?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Answer is B. 
Field Matching is the step that defines where the incoming data columns will be written in the receiving table when importing data from a spreadsheet. During the field matching step, you map the columns in the source file to the fields in the target table. This allows you to specify which columns in the source file correspond to which fields in the target table, ensuring that the data is imported correctly.

Selected Answer: D
Filed Mapping is what you do in Create Transform Map

The B answer says Filed Matching not Filed Mapping...
B is correct
D is correct. Field match was never considered a step. However Create Transform Map, is considered a step in the process.

Selected Answer: D
Questions is on which "step", so i would go with: D.Create Transform Map. At transform map you can then do field matching but the "step" is D.

Can I say NONE of the above? In reality you can create a transform map record by just specifying the source and target tables and clicking submit. You need to do the firld mapping before you transform. But it's Field MAPPING not Field Matching and it's done in the Transform Map (so it has to be there) through Auto Field Map Matching or Mapping Assist links. Very confusing question...

Selected Answer: D
D - Create Transform Map is the correct answer. 
B - Field Matching: For Event Management, when creating Event Rule to bind non-host CI using CI field matching, if there are multiple CI records having same name.
B is correct

Selected Answer: D
Answer should be Field Mapping. But we dont have that option. 
So its D because Transform Map is a set of field maps.

Wouldn't it be B if it was spelled correctly to Field Mapping? Note that not only the questions could be spelled incorrectly, I recognize that many answers are spelled incorrectly with or without purpose.

D. is correct

To apply a UI Policy to all views, set the Global setting to true.

Selected Answer: A
Per my PDI, "if the 'Global' checkbox is selected, the UI Policy applies to all form views; otherwise the UI Policy is view-specific".
Answer is A. If UI policy applies to extended table then answer is D. So here answer is A.

Answer is A.
Global [Advanced view] Option for specifying whether the UI policy applies to all form views. If this check box is cleared, the UI policy is view-specific.
By default, the Global UI policy applies to all form views. However, a UI policy can be specific to a view. For example, you can define a UI policy for only the itil view of a form. Use the View field to accomplish this.

Selected Answer: A
Answer is A

A : Global

choices.B: Identity source; Import transform map; Run transformer, Verify import
